properties.areaDesc: Southwest Chaves County; Eastern Lincoln County; South Central Mountains
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 4 at 11:21AM MST until February 5 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...MORE SNOW EXPECTED FOR CENTRAL AND EASTERN NEW MEXICO...

.A storm system will bring wintry weather to much of central and
eastern New Mexico through at least this evening. Up to 10 inches
of snowfall is possible across the mountain peaks and west facing
slopes while up to 4 inches could fall in the high valleys,
eastern highlands and plains. Temperatures will stay below
freezing today which will cause roadways to become icy and
snowpacked, especially along the I-25 corridor from Santa Fe to
Raton Pass as well as other mountain passes and I-40 from the
east mountain communities to the Texas border.

* WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4
inches with locally 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...South Central Mountains, Eastern Lincoln County and
Southwest Chaves County.

* WHEN...Until 6 AM MST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on icy and snow covered road conditions.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of falling and blowing
snow may reduce visibility below 1 mile.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST WEDNESDAY
